result.execSummary:
The defendant Ladale G. Singleton Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable court costs during period of probation. If not paid during probation, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No illegal controlled substances.
No violent contact with the victim.
No corporal punishment.

Successfully complete an anger management course.
Complete a parent class.
Any treatment as recommended by the agent.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED until next court date of 12-5-14

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ladale G. Singleton Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in court.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in court with attorney Avery L. Goodrich.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  C
ourt found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Court ordered defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, with 5 days credit for time served.
.
COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, STAYED until next court date.
-Successfully complete an anger management course.
-Complete a parent class.
-AODA assessment and treatment.
-No illegal controlled substances.
-Any treatment as recommended by the agent.
-Maintain employment. 
-No violent contact with the victim.
-No corporal punishment.
-Pay all applicable court costs during period of probation.  If not paid during probation, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay all appropriate costs, if not already paid, to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in court with attorney Avery L. Goodrich.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Due to court calendar congestion, matter cannot be heard.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court modified the no contact order to a No Violent Contact Order.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.

Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Child Abuse - Recklessly Cause Harm, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b), a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held off the record.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7/07/14 in Branch 40.  Defendant plans to resolve it on that date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial.  With no objection from the defense, Court granted state's motion to adjourn the 6/11/14 jury trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in court with attorney Avery L. Goodrich.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  No contact unless approved by the MBCW.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in court with attorney Avery L. Goodrich.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Detective Geri Lin Dunn.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J. S. (5/26/2010), UNLESS THE CONTACT IS APPROVED BY THE BUREAU OF MILWAUKEE CHILD WELFARE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Ladale G. Singleton in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
